guide.title: Portage bug handling
guide.abstract: Rules how to classify and resolve bug reports.

body.impo: This document is a draft and not in effect yet. Please don't link or refer to it yet unless you're discussing it.

body.p: All portage related bugs should be filed under the Portage Development product. Bugs reassigned from other projects should get the product changed to Portage Development.
The Version field should list the portage branch this bug will be fixed in. This is aimed to target a specific branch in the subversion repository for possible fixes.
This field is generally not used for portage bugs yet.

tr.ti: grammer or layout errors in messages, wrong colors, aynthing where no brain work is involved and functionality isn't affected
Typos, missing imports, indentation errors, other one-line fixes
Bugs that require more than a one-line fix, but are easy to work around
Bugs that prevent normal usage and require a lot of work
Issues that break/corrupt package building on a large scale
Critical data corruption or system breakage problems

body.p: Once a bug is supposed to be fixed in the subversion repository the InSVN keyword is set, so fixed bugs are easy to find at release time.
Indicator for developers that this bug should be looked into soon, mainly used for enhancement bugs.
For problems that didn't appear in a previous version. This does not apply for features that were intentionally dropped/changed.
